metadata.title: CASE 221/04: UNMIK Bank Account Investigation Final Report
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

overview: This document provides the final investigation report by the UNMIK Investigation Task Force on alleged irregularities associated with the UNMIK bank account. A conflict regarding the rightful ownership of funds generated from a contract with Air BP for Pristina Airport was identified. However, the investigation found no illegal activities concerning the account management.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Abusing Official Position of Authority under the Provisional Criminal Code of Kosovo.
Misappropriation in Office under the Provisional Criminal Code of Kosovo.
Fraud in Office under the Provisional Criminal Code of Kosovo.

background.context: Investigations focused on unresolved legal ownership and management of funds in the UNMIK bank account linked to the airport operations in Pristina.
entities_involved: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)
timeline: 2001-07-13;2001-07-20: UNMIK and the Company signed a contract for aviation fuel and refueling services.
2001-10-11: UNMIK Bank Account was opened at a Bank in Pristina.
2002-04-17: First payment to the UNMIK Bank Account via International Money Transfer (€ 45,105.23).
2003-02-01;2003-02-28: Forensic audit report by Chartered Accountants highlighted alleged irregularities.
2004-03-03: Contract amendment to supply additional aviation fuel and refueling services.
2004-07-14: Staff reassignments and notifications regarding account signatories.
2005-01-24: Latest payment made to account (€ 8,578.42), balance: € 537,536.90 as of 2005-03-04.

investigation_details.subject: Dispute and Alleged Mismanagement of Funds in UNMIK Bank Account

allegations.description: Irregular ownership and management of funds originating from Pristina Airport.
allegations.findings: No illegal withdrawals found; money derived from legal operations.

allegations.description: Disputed legal ownership of funds with no resolution, affecting airport operations.
allegations.findings: €537,536.90 remains in the account without interest accrual; investigation confirms legitimate business origins of funds.

findings: Funds generated through legitimate business dealings with Air BP.
No unauthorized transactions noted; only bank charges were deducted.

actions: UNMIK Pillar 4 - KTA should resolve ownership disputes promptly.
Examine deposit options to generate interest or redirect funds to operations benefiting UNMIK.
